Join us for a special MLK Day Protest!
Monday, January 19th, 11am–1pm, Burlington, MA

MLK Day Protest: Stand Against ICE

When: Monday, January 19th, 2026
Time: 11:00am – 1:00pm
Where:
  • 11:00am–12:00pm: Gather to hold protest signs at the corner of Burlington Mall Road
  • 12:00pm–1:00pm: Bear witness at 1000 District Ave, Burlington, MA
What: Songs, protest, and community. Bring your musical instruments and your voice!
Who: All are welcome. Come for camaraderie, spirit, and to stand up for justice.
Why MLK Day?
Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. stood for justice, equality, and the power of nonviolent protest. On this day, we gather in his spirit to oppose the injustices of ICE and to support our immigrant neighbors. Let us honor Dr. King's legacy by bearing witness, raising our voices, and building a community of hope and resistance.
Why protest ICE?
ICE continues to separate families, detain immigrants, and spread fear in our communities. We believe in a world where all people are treated with dignity and respect, regardless of immigration status. Join us to say NO to ICE and YES to justice and compassion.
This is a non-violent protest. We are committed to peaceful action and mutual respect. Our strength is in our unity and our love for justice.
Questions? Contact the organizers or just show up!
Let’s make this MLK Day a day of action, music, and solidarity.
